news.title: Former Dublin GAA boss Jim Gavin linked with Fianna Fáil bid for presidency
news.summary: Jim Gavin is the latest name to be linked with becoming Fianna Fáil’s presidential election candidate.

news.title: Richard Satchwell to appeal his conviction for murder of his wife Tina on six grounds
news.summary: Killer Richard Satchwell (58) is to appeal his murder conviction on six grounds including material he maintains should never have been put to the trial jury.

news.title: Fionnán Sheahan: As Seán Gallagher found out, scrutiny comes with the territory if you want to run for head of State
news.summary: A tug of the braces played a prime role in Michael D Higgins’s presidential victory. On the final weekend of a frenetic 2011 campaign, stories were swirling around his main rival, Seán Gallagher.

news.title: ‘I was sold on deadline day five times, but I’d never refuse to play’ – Eoin Doyle on the Alexander Isak standoff
news.summary: Newcastle host Liverpool at St James’ Park this evening, but the player on everyone’s lips will be nowhere to be seen.

news.title: The Indo Daily: Sally Rooney threatened under UK’s Terrorism Act – Could she face arrest?
news.summary: It’s been a dramatic week for Irish artists, activism and the UK’s terrorism law.

news.title: A sneak peek at Pope John Paul II and a few bob from Big Jack – Dublin Airport veteran reflects on highlights of 46-year career
news.summary: When Denis Smyth walked into Dublin Airport as a recruit in 1979, he had no idea he’d still be there almost half a century later.

news.title: Family of spiders rehomed and Slane Castle’s owners moved upstairs for filming of RTÉ’s ‘The Traitors’
news.summary: The cast of upcoming reality ­murder-mystery game show  The Traitors  may be faced with deception, betrayal and suspicion in the coming weeks, but at least they won’t be up against any creepy-crawlies.

news.title: Ask Allison: Since becoming a dad, I have no time for myself and my wife expects me to help out when I’m working from home
news.summary: I'm married with young kids and that brings its challenges. Babies came during Covid times and so I was home to help out a lot. My wife also had PND (postnatal depression), which we are lucky to be on the other side of.

news.title: Ciara Kelly: The backlash to U2’s statement illustrates that the woke are more interested in gatekeeping than truly supporting the people of Palestine
news.summary: I know I am slow to react to U2’s statement on the horrendous situation in Gaza. But I was thinking about it before I said anything – which is also bad it seems. Offering any kind of balance or nuance seems to be completely unacceptable. So be warned in advance: this article is going to be Outrageous!

news.title: The Irish Independent’s View: Ireland’s housing crisis still the biggest issue for ministers returning from summer break
news.summary: A ‘guide price’ is ­supposed to be the figure the seller hopes to get when selling their property on the open market. The sum is usually chosen by the auctioneer, on foot of assessing what similar properties in the area are going for.
